source.name: UN High Commissioner for Refugees

fields.title: North - West Syria: UNHCR Operational Update, January - March 2023
fields.body:
The earthquakes have worsened a long-standing humanitarian crisis in north-west Syria, where 2.7 million people were already displaced and living in temporary sites, and 4.1 million people are reliant on humanitarian assistance. 
 
UNHCR and its partners have scaled up the provision of core relief items and protection services to support those affected by the earthquakes. UNHCR has also strengthened the coordination of all three clusters under its responsibility.

file.filename: 230426 UNHCR Cross-border operation in north-west Syria Operational Update January-March 2023.pdf

fields.body-html:
The earthquakes have worsened a long-standing humanitarian crisis in north-west Syria, where 2.7 million people were already displaced and living in temporary sites, and 4.1 million people are reliant on humanitarian assistance.

UNHCR and its partners have scaled up the provision of core relief items and protection services to support those affected by the earthquakes. UNHCR has also strengthened the coordination of all three clusters under its responsibility.

text:
# North - West Syria: UNHCR Operational Update, January - March 2023

The earthquakes have worsened a long-standing humanitarian crisis in north-west Syria, where 2.7 million people were already displaced and living in temporary sites, and 4.1 million people are reliant on humanitarian assistance. 
 
UNHCR and its partners have scaled up the provision of core relief items and protection services to support those affected by the earthquakes. UNHCR has also strengthened the coordination of all three clusters under its responsibility.
summary: In north-west Syria, a long-standing humanitarian crisis has been exacerbated by earthquakes. UNHCR and its partners have increased the provision of relief items and protection services to those affected, and have strengthened the coordination of the three clusters under their responsibility. 2.7 million people are displaced and 4.1 million are reliant on humanitarian assistance.
